about_the_game:
"リア充爆発しろ！ Normies Should Burn!" is a novel game about a socially awkward protagonist who envies popular people and engages in small acts of mischief against them. One day, he meets a girl who is doing the same thing, and together, they use a transformation ability they happen to acquire to undertake a mission to eradicate the normies.


A "normie" is someone who leads a fulfilling life! (,,#ﾟДﾟ)!

The protagonist, Satoru, doesn't have a lover or even friends and has become the ultimate social misfit and the epitome of a "loser". (´・ω・`)
Harboring resentment and envy towards normies, he spends his days writing on his blog.
"Normies should buuuuurrrrnnnnnnnn!!!!"

One day, in the middle of his scheme to get back at the popular kids who called him gross,
he met a suspicious girl who seemed to be plotting the same thing...

The two of them, barely able to communicate, somehow formed an alliance through written notes and even acquired the legendary ability to transform!
Will their plan to eradicate the popular kids succeed!? Or...? (:.;ﾟ;Д;ﾟ;.:)


Nanami Sekiya
She looks cute but is severely socially awkward and has no friends.
She shares the same ideology as Satoru and is dedicated to eradicating social butterflies, but she's a bit off in some ways.

Rio Kurusu
A bright and kind girl who talks to everyone in a friendly manner!
She treats outcasts equally.

Tsukushi Kamigusa
A lively girl one year younger who feels like a little sister.
She flaunts her lovey-dovey relationship with her older boyfriend, which annoys some of the other students.

Misaki Kayano
A popular girl with a flashy appearance who hates nerdy things!
She despises timid people and calls them gross when she encounters them.

Satoru Inaba
A severely socially awkward guy whose efforts always backfire.
Because of this, he harbors resentment towards happy, sociable people and engages in petty harassment.

content_descriptors.notes: Some scenes in the game contain mild sexual content and fantasy pranks. Not intended for children or all ages.
